alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 10:14AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Buckingham. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 AM EDT, The Slate River at Arvonia was at 13.19 feet. The river continues to slowly rise but should crest soon, then fall below flood stage by noon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... James River, Slate River and Rocky Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Buckingham County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
